main.name: Panisara Lertrungwichian
main.description: Originally from Thailand, I have been studying and working in the US for six years in pursuit of knowledge and long term employment.
bio: I am particularly interested in utilizing the power of our own immune system to fight off various infections and diseases. We are all born with built-in armies that help protect us from infections, but not everyone of us were born with healthy and intact immune functions which make them more susceptible to various diseases. Also, the immune function will have to work extra hard when there is infection which overtime, makes us even more vulnerable to infections. With that being said, I am interested in improving our own immune function by boosting the immune cells such as T cells, altering/genetic engineering structures of immune cells so they could potentially target specific antigen, manipulating our immune responses to work better in fighting off cancer or related diseases, and so on. I am also interested in learning about the mechanism of T cell such as its metabolism, its interaction with other immune cells or cancer/infected cells because I believe T cell is the master controller in our immune responses (adaptive and innate), which are very important when it comes to fighting off infections. I am also interested in learning and gaining knowledge about mechanism of stem cells, particularly on blood stem cells involving in generating specific immune cells related to cancer to possibly reduce tumor progression.

I am a highly motivated and fast-paced individual who enjoys collaborating with others, learning new techniques, expanding my scientific skills and knowledge, and working independently on the bench. My undergraduate hard science courses with physiological/anatomical and cadaver labs and working in the laboratory setting with experiences in mammalian cell culture, sterile techniques, accurately utilizing multichannel pipettes, preforming XTT assay, collecting data, utilizing Microsoft excel, following protocol/procedure, data analysis, and collaborating with other undergraduate researchers, have assured me even more to pursue career in immune-related research field. I hope to help developing more effective techniques to eliminate cancer/related diseases and provide improved treatments to patients who may face immune-related health issues in the future. Lastly, I would love to be a part of your research team to help develop immunotherapy for those who may need.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Integrated Human Biology
education.description: Spent time in laboratory setting with knowledge of sterilization techniques, maintaining and preparing stock reagents, tissue culturing, XTT assay (cell viability), data analysis, collaboration, and word and excel software.
Initial introduction to hard science courses with labs

research.title: Undergraduate Researcher
research.description:
- Curiously researched on ongoing pandemic disease.
- Independently gathered scientific information on replication cycle, pathogenesis of SARS-CoV-2 and currrent COVID-19 treatments.
- Wrote a scientific review paper on SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19.

research.lab: Messner Lab, Bastyr University (Basic science department)
research.title: Undergraduate Researcher
research.description:
- Created and performed different treatment conditions on iron overloaded rat hepatocyte epithelial cells, T51B cells.
- Detected cell viability and determined concentration-dependent of Tetrahydrocurcumin (THC) and curcumin.
- Accurately utilized spectrophotometry and analyzed data using excel software.
- Gathered previous reseach papers done on THC, its iron binding and oxidative stress and wrote a draft scientific paper.

research.lab: Messner Lab, Bastyr University (Basic science department)
research.title: Undergraduate Researcher
research.description:
- Prepared and maintained stock reagents.
- Performed MCF-7 cells plating, maintenance, and counting in culture dishes.
- Performed cytotoxicity test and analyzed collected data using excel software.
- Collaborated with other undergraduate researchers.

research.title: Undergraduate Researcher

- Proposed research project.

- Designed a step by step research project to determine cytotoxic effect of alpha-mangostin and/or *Tinospora* extracts on human colon cancer, HCT 116, cells.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
